snippet: John Giles, president of the Central Maine and Quebec Railway, said he hoped to have an agreement with officials in Quebec that would allow the railroad to ship nonhazardous goods.
abstract: Central Maine and Quebec Railway, company purchasing assets of a railroad responsible for fiery oil train derailment that claimed 47 lives in Quebec, says it hopes to have agreement with officials in Lac-Megantic, Quebec, to resume oil shipments after track safety improvements are made.
lead_paragraph: John Giles, president of the Central Maine and Quebec Railway, said he hoped to have an agreement with officials in Quebec that would allow the railroad to ship nonhazardous goods.

headline.main: New Owner of Railway to Resume Oil Shipments
headline.print_headline: New Owner of Railway to Resume Oil Shipments
